result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Must have no contact with H.M.W. dob 10/22/1974.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages. 
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold for consumption on the premises.
May return to residence one time with Law Enforcement to retrieve personal belongings.

1:11 PM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew V Weber appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Knaak appears by Zoom video for today only.
Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney.  Address confirmed and phone number updated.  1:13 p.m. Defendant and Attorney Knaak put in a break-out room to discuss bond.  1:17 p.m. case recalled.  Bond set.  AIA set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
